sentence.Network_en: They tend to buy cheap processed foods like canned chicken and macaroni.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们往往会买便宜的加工食品，像鸡肉罐头和通心粉之类的。

sentence.Network_en: He sat down to a great dish of macaroni.
sentence.Network_cn: 他坐下来吃了一大碗通心粉.

sentence.Network_en: The last scene shows you what will happen at the end of the harvest: the famous Calabrian macaroni - eating competition!
sentence.Network_cn: 最后这个场面向你表明,收获结束时将要进行的活动: 卡拉布亚人吃通心面的对抗赛!

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Italian maccaroni (now usually spelled maccheroni), plural of maccarone, from late Greek makaria 'food made from barley'

entry.def: Macaroni is a kind of pasta made in the shape of short hollow tubes.

means.word_mean: 1. a British dandy in the 18th century who affected Continental mannerisms;

sentences.sentence: "Yankee Doodle stuck a feather in his cap and called it macaroni"

means.word_mean: 2. pasta in the form of slender tubes
